    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/bernardmarr/2016/05/13/what-is-affective-computing-and-how-could-emotional-machines-change-our-lives/</link>
      <title>What is Affective Computing And How Could Emotional Machines Change Our Lives?</title>
      <description>How would your computer respond if you looked frustrated or upset? &nbsp;Could your phone comfort you if you were sad after getting a call? &nbsp;Could your smart home adjust the music, lighting, or other aspects of the environment around you after you&rsquo;ve had a bad day at work &mdash; without being asked?</description>
      <dc:creator>Bernard Marr</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/bernardmarr/2016/05/13/what-is-affective-computing-and-how-could-emotional-machines-change-our-lives/</guid>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:35:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-13T02:35:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/bernardmarr/files/2016/05/shutterstock_327630251.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/bernardmarr/files/2016/05/shutterstock_327630251.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/caseyhall/2016/05/13/is-apple-backing-chinas-uber-rival-to-make-good-with-the-chinese-government/</link>
      <title>Is Apple Backing China's Uber Rival To Make Good With The Chinese Government?</title>
      <description>Apple Inc. hasn&rsquo;t had the smoothest ride in China in recent months, with it&rsquo;s Apple Entertainment content platform taken offline by regulators only months after becoming available on the mainland, local competition bumping the Apple&rsquo;s iPhone from the top of the smartphone tree and a Beijing court ruling against the tech giant in a trademark infringement case.</description>
      <dc:creator>Casey Hall</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/caseyhall/2016/05/13/is-apple-backing-chinas-uber-rival-to-make-good-with-the-chinese-government/</guid>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 04:59:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-13T00:59:00Z</dc:date>

      </media:content>
    </item>

      <title>Does Facebook Suffer From Unconscious Bias? An Insider View Into Human Cataloging</title>
      <description>As someone who has helped run numerous large human cataloging projects similar to Facebook's, here’s what’s likely going on and how unconscious bias is likely driving the questions around Facebook’s Trending Topics</description>

      <title>Love It Or Hate it, Instagram's New Logo Is So Internet Right Now</title>
      <description>Instagram revealed a new, updated design for themselves yesterday and naturally, many good people of the Internet lost it. (The New York Times called the resulting online explosion of strong opinions, jokes, GIFs and virtual hand-wringing a &ldquo;freakout.&rdquo;)</description>

    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/kathleenchaykowski/2016/05/12/facebook-publishes-its-policy-on-trending-topics/</link>
      <title>Facebook Publishes Its Policy On 'Trending Topics'</title>
      <description>Responding to a media firestorm that erupted this week over how Facebook puts together its prominent "Trending Topics" section for its 1.7 billion users, the company publicly shared its internal guidelines for running the feature.</description>
      <dc:creator>Kathleen Chaykowski</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/kathleenchaykowski/2016/05/12/facebook-publishes-its-policy-on-trending-topics/</guid>

    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/centurylink/2016/05/12/multi-cloud-understanding-the-promise-vs-the-reality/</link>
      <title>Multi-Cloud: Understanding The Promise Vs. The Reality</title>
      <description>The multi-cloud paradigm is undergoing the kind of post-hype contrition that so many promising ideas experience once their initial glow starts to fade.&nbsp; You might think, right, of course it is. Or, you might be wondering, &ldquo;What is multi-cloud?&rdquo; No matter. We will explain all. The purpose of this article is to review what multi-cloud was supposed to be and why it hasn&rsquo;t matured in the way that has been articulated by many thought leaders. At the same time, we will point out how many of the best ideas contained in the multi-cloud concept can be realized through existing cloud technologies.</description>
      <dc:creator>Jim Battenberg</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/centurylink/2016/05/12/multi-cloud-understanding-the-promise-vs-the-reality/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:18:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T15:18:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/centurylink/files/2016/05/promisevreality1.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/centurylink/files/2016/05/promisevreality1.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>

    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/johnellett/2016/05/12/salesforce-enhances-its-marketing-cloud-for-more-seamless-customer-experience-management/</link>
      <title>Salesforce Enhances Its Marketing Cloud For More Seamless Customer Experience Management</title>
      <description>This week at its annual marketing conference, Salesforce Marketing Cloud rolled out enhancements to its platform to better plan and execute 1:1 customer experiences across multiple touch points. The company has extended Salesforce Lightning, which previously brought enhancements to Sales Cloud and Service Cloud to Marketing Cloud in order for companies to deliver smarter journeys across the entire Customer Success Platform. In addition, the company announced Marketing Cloud for Google Customer Match, the latest innovation in its ongoing strategic partnership with Google, which marketers can use to deploy CRM-powered advertising across Google Search, YouTube and Gmail.</description>
      <dc:creator>John Ellett</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/johnellett/2016/05/12/salesforce-enhances-its-marketing-cloud-for-more-seamless-customer-experience-management/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:52:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T14:52:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/johnellett/files/2016/05/Scott-McCorkle-Headshot.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/johnellett/files/2016/05/Scott-McCorkle-Headshot.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>

    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/teradata/2016/05/12/slay-the-vuca-dragon/</link>
      <title>Slay The VUCA Dragon</title>
      <description>Although the military coined the acronym VUCA, which represents the extremely volatile, uncertain, complex and ambiguous conditions that are often encountered in battle, the business world has adopted the relevant term to its own environment.</description>
      <dc:creator>Teradata Perspectives</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/teradata/2016/05/12/slay-the-vuca-dragon/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:11:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T14:11:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/teradata/files/2016/05/dragonnn.png">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/teradata/files/2016/05/dragonnn.png"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/teradata/2016/05/12/big-data-costs-money-big-analytics-makes-money/</link>
      <title>Big Data Costs Money. Big Analytics Makes Money.</title>
      <description>The word easy is not often associated with big data, but there is at least one pretty easy answer when it comes to the question of why companies embark on big data deployments: money, whether it is making it or saving it. What may be less obvious is why, despite their best intentions, organizations are sometimes getting lost along the big data road. Instead of improving the bottom line through the power of deep insights, big data becomes more of an expense than a boost.</description>
      <dc:creator>Randy Lea</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/teradata/2016/05/12/big-data-costs-money-big-analytics-makes-money/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 18:10:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T14:10:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/teradata/files/2016/05/baby.png">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/teradata/files/2016/05/baby.png"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>

    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/davidthier/2016/05/12/hitmans-elusive-targets-sound-terrifying-and-awesome/</link>
      <title>'Hitman's' Elusive Targets Sound Terrifying And Awesome</title>
      <description>For me, Hitman has been something of a sleeper hit of the spring. It's a bold game: possibly our first episodic AAA, giving players a new murder sandbox every month(ish?), replete with dozens of different avenues towards mayhem professional, quiet, ridiculous and loud, with a touch of high-class European tourism to set things off. These murder boxes house not only a main quest with several different ways of taking out your targets, but also various other game modes, the most interesting of which arrives this weekend: elusive target.</description>
      <dc:creator>Dave Thier</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/davidthier/2016/05/12/hitmans-elusive-targets-sound-terrifying-and-awesome/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:54:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T13:54:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/davidthier/files/2016/05/HITMAN-Episode-2-Preview-1-1200x675.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/davidthier/files/2016/05/HITMAN-Episode-2-Preview-1-1200x675.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/davidthier/2016/05/12/graphics-uncharted-4-may-very-well-be-the-last-of-its-kind/</link>
      <title>'Uncharted 4' May Very Well Be The Last Of Its Kind</title>
      <description>Uncharted 4 is the end of that story -- the perfect version of an Uncharted game, a staggering technical achievement, and a fitting, complete end to a story now five games in the making. It's one of the best video game experiences I've had in months, and it's a sort of game that we're not going to see again for a long time.</description>
      <dc:creator>Dave Thier</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/davidthier/2016/05/12/graphics-uncharted-4-may-very-well-be-the-last-of-its-kind/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:41:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T13:41:00Z</dc:date>

      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>

      <title>'Star Wars' BB-8 Droid Is Everywhere You Want To Be</title>
      <description>Hey, we're not saying that BB-8, the roly-poly breakout star of Star Wars: The Force Awakens, was developed specifically for all the toys he could sell, so here's a cartoon by Shannon Wheeler.</description>

    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/jlim/2016/05/12/xero-fy2016-revenue-up-67-to-207-1-million/</link>
      <title>Xero FY2016 Revenue Up 67% To $207.1 Million</title>
      <description>Xero Limited (NZX: XRO, ASX: XRO), the cloud accounting software company posted its 2016 year-end financials yesterday. Operating revenues rose 67% on FY15 to NZ$207.1 million or US$141.2 million with annualized committed monthly revenue reaching NZ$257.9 million. </description>
      <dc:creator>Jason Lim</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/jlim/2016/05/12/xero-fy2016-revenue-up-67-to-207-1-million/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:42:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T12:42:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/jlim/files/2016/05/Rod-Drury-2-1200x783.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/jlim/files/2016/05/Rod-Drury-2-1200x783.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/bradmoon/2016/05/12/kuke-case-a-fix-for-your-iphones-battery-and-storage-problems/</link>
      <title>KUKE Case: A Fix For Your iPhone's Battery And Storage Problems</title>
      <description>If you own an iPhone 6 or iPhone 6s, there’s a pretty good chance you opted for the least expensive, 16GB model. Most people do. However, it doesn’t take long to chew through that storage and I’ll bet you’d appreciate longer battery life, too. The KUKE case from Kuner addresses both of those issues, as well as offering protection from bumps.</description>
      <dc:creator>Brad Moon</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/bradmoon/2016/05/12/kuke-case-a-fix-for-your-iphones-battery-and-storage-problems/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:07:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T12:07:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/bradmoon/files/2016/05/Kuke-iPhone-Case-500x500.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/bradmoon/files/2016/05/Kuke-iPhone-Case-500x500.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/olliebarder/2016/05/12/hollywood-is-going-after-manga-and-anime-properties-in-a-big-way-still-has-no-clue/</link>
      <title>Hollywood Is Going After Manga And Anime Properties In A Big Way, Still Has No Clue</title>
      <description>In a really interesting and thorough piece over at The Hollywood Reporter, it seems that many in Hollywood are going crazy over the potential for manga and anime properties for new movies. However, considering their track record this is definitely not a good thing.</description>
      <dc:creator>Ollie Barder</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/olliebarder/2016/05/12/hollywood-is-going-after-manga-and-anime-properties-in-a-big-way-still-has-no-clue/</guid>

      <dc:date>2016-05-12T12:00:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/olliebarder/files/2016/04/gits_new_movie-1200x675.jpg">

      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/joannmuller/2016/05/12/tesla-can-build-all-the-cars-it-wants-the-real-challenge-could-be-selling-them/</link>
      <title>Tesla Can Build All The Cars It Wants. The Real Challenge Could Be Selling Them</title>
      <description>Tesla is prohibited from selling cars directly to consumers in many states where laws protect franchised car dealers. Expert testimony in a hearing in Virginia over the issue offers some interesting indications on how big a problem this could be for the upstart automaker.</description>
      <dc:creator>Joann Muller</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/joannmuller/2016/05/12/tesla-can-build-all-the-cars-it-wants-the-real-challenge-could-be-selling-them/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:56:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T11:56:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://specials-images.forbesimg.com/imageserve/170047932/960x0.jpg?fit=scale">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://specials-images.forbesimg.com/imageserve/170047932/960x0.jpg?fit=scale"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <link>http://www.forbes.com/sites/briankoberlein/2016/05/12/astronomers-probably-discovered-1284-new-planets/</link>
      <title>Astronomers Probably Discovered 1,284 New Planets</title>
      <description>NASA's Kepler mission has announced the discovery of 1,284 newly confirmed planets, raising the total confirmed exoplanets to more than 3,000. While this is a big step forward in exoplanet astronomy, it is also part of a shift in how exoplanets are discovered. That's because these new planets weren't discovered individually, but rather through an automated algorithm that gives candidate&nbsp;planets a statistical thumbs up or down. </description>
      <dc:creator>Brian Koberlein</dc:creator>
      <guid>http://www.forbes.com/sites/briankoberlein/2016/05/12/astronomers-probably-discovered-1284-new-planets/</guid>
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:49:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <dc:date>2016-05-12T11:49:00Z</dc:date>
      <media:content url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/briankoberlein/files/2016/05/Kepler-Comparison-2-1200x466.jpg">
        <media:thumbnail url="http://blogs-images.forbes.com/briankoberlein/files/2016/05/Kepler-Comparison-2-1200x466.jpg"/>
      </media:content>
    </item>
